events.title: Birth of Benjamin Franklin
events.description: Benjamin Franklin, one of the United States' Founding Fathers, was born in Boston, Massachusetts.
events.significance: Franklin's later work as a diplomat, scientist, writer, and statesman helped shape American independence, governance, and Enlightenment science.

events.title: Battle of Cowpens
events.description: American forces under General Daniel Morgan defeated a British force commanded by Banastre Tarleton near Cowpens, South Carolina.
events.significance: A turning point in the Southern Campaign of the American Revolutionary War, boosting American morale and demonstrating effective use of tactics and militia.‚Äù

events.title: First meeting of the United Nations Security Council
events.description: The UN Security Council held its inaugural meeting in London, establishing the body that would oversee international peace and security.
events.significance: Laid the groundwork for the UN's postwar security architecture and the council's authority to authorize actions and sanctions.

events.title: Birth of Jim Carrey
events.description: Canadian-American actor and comedian Jim Carrey was born in Newmarket, Ontario.
events.significance: One of the era's most recognizable and influential comedic performers, with a major impact on film and television comedy.

events.title: Desert Storm air campaign begins
events.description: Coalition air forces began an intensive bombing campaign against Iraq as Desert Storm commenced in the Gulf War.
events.significance: Marked the start of a major modern warfare operation with wide geopolitical consequences and reshaped regional power dynamics.
